title: Marina Joyce worries fans as she insists she never actually went missing
text:
Marina’s fans are still concerned for her wellbeing (Picture: YouTube)

YouTuber Marina Joyce has continued to worry fans by insisting she never actually went missing as she made her Twitter return.

The internet personality and video maker, who is known for her lifestyle YouTube channel, hit headlines after a missing persons appeal declared that Marina had not been seen for nine days, with the police confirming the news to Metro.co.uk.

The next day, the 22-year-old was fortunately found ‘safe and well’, with her boyfriend Brandon Mehmed telling fans not to worry about the star and that she would be creating a video explaining what happened in due course.

‘Marina wants to make a video soon explaining all of this because it became a bit too much what with everyone thinking I’m a suspect and all,’ Brandon wrote on Instagram.

However, while the video is yet to be made, Marina, who has more than 2 million subscribers on the video sharing platform, returned to Twitter today to tell her side of the story, confusingly stated that she was never actually missing.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘I never went missing in the first place,’ she cryptically wrote, refuting claims made by charity Missing People and Haringey Police.

I never went missing in the first place. Also, Brandon has been so loyal throughout all this so dont trust anybody but him when somebody says something because hes the one who knows everything and is my closest, and protects me more than any other person out there — Marina Rose Joyce (@MarinaJoyce7) October 9, 2019

‘Also, Brandon has been so loyal throughout all this so dont trust anybody but him when somebody says something because hes the one who knows everything and is my closest, and protects me more than any other person out there [sic].’

Erm, OK?

Naturally, Marina’s fans expressed their concern at her message, asking her if she was OK in reply.

R u ok — GuyBehindAPhone (@dramaexpert27) October 9, 2019

This doesn’t sound suspicious or anything like that 🙄 — 🦆April🦆 (@i_am_psyduck2) October 9, 2019

‘Girl pls go somewhere safe,’ one wrote, while others echoed their concern at Marina’s choice to break her radio silence to send this tweet defending her partner.

The subject of multiple conspiracy theories, Marina sparked mass panic among her fans in 2016 who believed there was a cry for help hidden inside one of her videos.

The video DATE VIDEO IDEAS saw Marina at one point seemingly whisper ‘help me’ very quietly while her arms were also bruised.

description: YouTuber Marina Joyce has continued to worry fans by insisting she never actually went missing as she made her Twitter return.
